answers.answer: Hi, MPO in the blood is a specific marker of vascular inflammation and vulnerable plaque/erosions/fissures. Its a predictor of heart disease. It may also be raised in peripheral vascular diseases. If you do not have any cardiac symptoms now, you can wait and watch and monitor your levels. Also, focus on controlling hypertension, diabetes and weight gain. Take care.

question: November 22, 2013 VAP test results from Cleveland HeartLab showed MPO at 601 pmol/L and Total HDL 35 mg/dL.  All other results are good. (11/2012 displayed values MPO of 390 with HDL at 32).  Lifestyle is good except for more exercise is needed. Some minor dental work concludes 1/29/2014.  Doctor is deferring repeat VAP until 2/19/2014.  Besides cardiac issues, can MPO be elevated by any other factors?Beginning last November, am I a walking cardiac time bomb with a 6 month time frame to explode?Thanks for your kind attention to this.Ceachell
title: MPO cardiac test results
